events.name: Study Group
events.description:
• What we'll do
Our study group is for anyone interested in web development! Perhaps you want to set aside some time to work on that personal project, or you've just started learning to code and need a bit of help. Maybe you just want to discover something new outside of your expertise!

This is your chance to meet, work alongside, and learn with some friendly people who want to practise and improve their skills. The group is beginner and women-friendly, but we welcome anyone who has been invited along by a member. Please bring along your laptop, project, coursework, or come and chat to us if you're not sure where to start!

We'll have some drinks and nibbles available too, kindly provided by IRESS and ThoughtWorks.

We look forward to seeing you there :)

• What to bring
Laptop
events.how_to_find_us: If you arrive after 6pm please call Lina 0420815148 or Duyen 0421937368

events.name: API Security + Deployment and features of the Jelastic PaaS platform
events.description:
This month's meetup will have two lightning talks on:
- API Security
- Deployment and features of the Jelastic PaaS platform

*Secure your API*

Zaki will be giving the talk on API Security. The talk will explore basic security principles, TLS, Authentication, Authorization, OAuth2, JWT. You will also learn how to mitigate common attacks and how API gateways can help.

*Deployment and features of the Jelastic PaaS platform*

Will Kruss from Cloudlets.com.au will demonstrate deployment and features of the Jelastic product-as-a-service platform.

The demonstration will include deployment directly from Github and configuration for automatic re-deployment on commit with Git-Push-Deploy.

Jelastic marketplace deployment and configuration of Magnolia CMS. Platform configuration for load balancing and clustering. Demonstration of load based vertical and horizontal scaling.

*Sponsors*
A big thanks to Oracle+Aconex for providing their venue as our regular home and providing food for these events. There will be no alcohol available.

Also our other regular sponsors, including our newest sponsor ***Hays***, who support the community and facilitate the growth of the meetup. See https://melbjvm.com/sponsors

*Find us*
Oracle Level 10, 140 William Street
events.how_to_find_us: If entering the building at the front, the lifts to level 10 are around to the right.

events.description:
The MelbJVM user group meets the first Wednesday of every month usually meeting at the Oracle+Aconex office in the CBD.

Topics cover Java and related JVM languages, frameworks and other trends on the platform.

Also our other regular sponsors, including our newest sponsor ***Attribute Group***, who support the community and facilitate the growth of the meetup. See https://melbjvm.com/sponsors

events.name: The Layman's Guide To Software Architecture
events.description:
MANDATORY REGISTRATION VIA THIS LINK:
https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/the-laymans-guide-to-software-architecture-tickets-74674783287?aff=Meetup

Join us for the next By ThoughtWorks tech-talk series. Mingle, learn, and hang out with those wanting to keep up with the latest in technology. It’s our shout, so please join us for a fun and casual session over drinks and nibbles with networking to follow.

THE LAYMAN'S GUIDE TO SOFTWARE ARCHITECTURE
You might expect that that this forty five minutes session will completely summarise everything you need to know about software architecture. Unfortunately, it most probably will not. Instead, this session is the next best thing: A guide for the uninitiated; explained for the layman. Just enough to get you started.

This is my humble take on what "just enough" knowledge is:
- Is there an easy way to understand what software architecture is?
- How do you explain the role of an architect?
- How does design fit into architecture?
- Who makes technical decisions?
- When should decisions be made?
- What should be the primary focus for decision making?

If you are a software professional such as a Developer, BA, QA, PM or Architect who wants to know more about the general principles of software architecture, then sign up and join us in the discussion!

SPEAKER:
Liauw Fendy, Lead Consultant, ThoughtWorks

Fendy is a Lead Developer with ThoughtWorks. He has worked in ThoughtWorks for 9 years across North America, Brazil, Thailand, China and Australia. His experience spans software delivery, I.T. assessments, enablement, discovery, inception, and coaching / training engagements. Most recently, his focus has been in internal capability development where he has trained fellow colleagues on technical leadership skills.

AGENDA:
5.30- 6.00 pm - Arrive and Networking Drinks and Nibbles
6.00 - 7.00 pm - Presentation and Discussion
7.00 - 8.00 pm - Networking and Drinks
8.00 pm - Close

Register now as places are limited!

MANDATORY REGISTRATION VIA THIS LINK:
https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/the-laymans-guide-to-software-architecture-tickets-74674783287?aff=Meetup

events.name: The Big Cloud Security Debate: Hackers vs Security Engineers
events.description:
To RSVP you MUST register here:
https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/the-big-cloud-security-debate-hackers-vs-security-engineers-tickets-72652542711

ANZ, Contino and Meetup Madness are excited to invite you to ‘THE BIG CLOUD SECURITY DEBATE - HACKERS VS SECURITY ENGINEERS’. Featuring some of Australia's most renowned professional hackers and security experts… Who will come out on top?

How it works 4 hackers vs 4 security experts engaging in a fiery debate to determine all the ways they can hack and defend cloud environments.

The discussion will be moderated by 4 industry leaders. The debate will consist of 8 rounds with audience voting after each round.

The team who wins most votes at the end of the night will be named the champions of ‘THE BIG CLOUD SECURITY DEBATE’.

Moderators:

- Lynwen Connick, Chief Information Security Officer, ANZ
- Pierre Semaan, Portfolio Owner, Enterprise Cloud Portfolio, ANZ
- Pamela O'Shea, Ph.D, Principal Security Consultant, Shea Information Security, Founder of HaXX and Cyberspectrum
- Michael Ewald, Director of Engineering - APAC, Contino

Red Team (Hackers):

- Rebecca Trapani (@errbufferoverfl), Senior Security Consultant, Loop Secure
- Michael McKinnon, Strategic Information Security Advisor at PS&C Security
- Adi Ashkenazy, CEO, Skylight Cyber, Offensive Security Expert
- TBC

Blue Team (Security Engineers):

- Edward Farrell, Director & Principal Consultant, Mercury Information Security Services
- Sarah Young, Azure Security Global Black Belt, Microsoft
- Jean-Manuel Becker, Cloud Practice Director, Contino
- TBC

If you are keen to debate, please reach out to [masked]

https://meetupmadness.io/code-of-conduct/

events.name: Melbourne APIs Meet Up - Episode Three
events.description:
We're back again for our last edition before the summer holidays. After recharging our batteries we'll be kicking things off again in late February!

Speakers on the night are:

Tharindu Edirisinghe (Graduate Researcher, La Trobe University)

"OWASP API Security Top 10: The need for enterprise solutions for managing API security"

In this session, Tharindu will explore how enterprise API management solutions can be utilised for managing the security of APIs throughout their life-cycle and also walk you through the latest addition to the API security standards, which is the OWASP API Security Top 10 list.

**Second speaker TBC**

Again, we'll have plenty of food and drinks going around.

We look forward to seeing both familiar and new faces!

Scott, Harrison & Dylan

events.name: Everything API Melbourne Meetup #2
events.description:
Let's do this!
Everyone needs a strong and reliable Number 2, and so it is with our Everything API Melbourne Meet-up.

Building on the success of the first meet-up, we'll be holding this in the Melbourne Accelerator Program (https://www.themap.co/), which has been investing in start-ups in Melbourne since 2012.

This will be a good chance to network with a community of people interested in APIs, and who can forget the talks, the drinks and food!

events.name: Tiny Spec Melbourne
events.description:
↓↓↓ --=== Humans must RSVP for this event here. RSVPs on Meetup will not be counted. --=== ↓↓↓

<br/>https://slackcommunity.com/events/details/slack-melbourne-presents-tiny-spec-melbourne/

<p>Come join the Slack Platform team at our Melbourne offices for an evening of discussion around the latest developments on the Slack Platform. We'll have updates from the team on the news since our annual developer conference, Spec.</p><p>Apps are a fundamental part of bringing workflows into Slack, improving the way teams work together. But the Slack Platform isn’t just a set of APIs to connect workflows and teams—it’s a global community with the resources, support, and tools you need to be successful.</p><p>Interested in running this chapter? We'd love to connect! Get in touch before the event or meet up with us there to discuss!</p></p>

Agenda<br/>

6:00 PM: Registration and refreshments<br/>

6:45 PM: Welcome<br/>

6:50 PM: An introduction to Slack Platform<br/>

7:05 PM: Let's talk tokens: permissions and access in Slack Platform<br/>

7:20 PM: Beyond the surface: Building on Block Kit<br/>

7:50 PM: Q&A Panel<br/>

8:15 PM: Networking<br/>

9:00 PM: Event ends<br/>

<br/>

<br/>---<br/>

<br/>
Speaker<br/>

Bear Douglas - Slack (Head of Developer Relations)<br/>

Bear Douglas is a Developer Advocate at Slack, where she and her team help developers build more pleasant and productive ways to work. Before Slack, she led the Developer Relations teams for the mobile and data platforms at Twitter, and worked on native mobile DevRel at Facebook and Parse. She’s passionate about developer experience, great documentation, and a cappella music.<br/>

<br/>

<br/>
Hosted By<br/>

Elizabeth Kinsey, Developer Marketing & Community<br/>

I look after developer marketing and community at Slack. I find myself typing /shrug in every messaging platform, expecting it to work. My favorite Slack apps are Guru and Google Calendar, but don't tell Slack Bot that. /remind will always hold a special place in my heart.<br/>

<br/>

<br/>---<br/>

<br/>
Global Partner<br/>

Slack (https://slack.com)<br/>;
Slack is the collaboration hub that brings the right people, information, and tools together to get work done. From Fortune 100 companies to corner markets, millions of people around the world use Slack to connect their teams, unify their systems, and drive their business forward.<br/>
<br/>

<br/>

<br/>---<br/>

<br/>
Slack Platform Community meetups are for developers, product managers, and designers who are interested in building integrations with Slack that make their teams' lives easier. Our groups meet to talk about what we've built, check out new platform releases, and connect with other people who are interested in building the future of work. Join us at slackcommunity.com.<br/>
<br/>---<br/>

<br/>

events.name: GraphQL Melbourne
events.description:
6:00pm – Doors open.

6:30pm – Alaister Young: Intro to Postgraphile: Rapid GraphQL API development on Postgres
Many of the applications we build today revolve around CRUD. Postgraphile generates customisable CRUD actions for you, allowing you to focus on implementing your business logic. Postgraphile allows you to fully leverage the power of Postgres’ through your GraphQL API - and if you can’t do something in SQL, it easily is extendable through JavaScript.

7:15pm – Break for food, drinks and chat.

8:00pm – Jayden Seric: Declarative image preloading
Often GraphQL schemas contain fields that resolve URLs for assets such as profile pictures. Learn how to setup a GraphQL server so clients can specify via field args which URLs the browser should automatically prefetch or preload, using vanilla HTTP Link headers. Load images the moment the GraphQL response is received, instead of when elements finally mount. Preload slideshow images without hacky JS! Learn how next-graphql-react forwards such headers to the client after SSR, and other tips and tricks.

8:45pm – Event finish.
---

If you’re interested in presenting at one of the meetups, please message either David Burles or Jayden Seric here on meetup.com.
events.how_to_find_us: From the Stewart Street exit of Richmond Station, look to the right for the alley with the “41-43 Stewart St” sign. Start down the alley, then take the first left. The entrance to 29 Stewart St will be on your right, and Culture Amp is on Level 2.

events.name: TECHLED #Melbourne - Tech Leadership networking with 3 Tech-Talks
TECH TALK NOVEMBER | Platform Engineers Melbourne
events.description:
YOU NEED TO REGISTER TO ATTEND: https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/tech-talk-november-platform-engineers-melbourne-tickets-76520349425

SESSION 1
Title: Serverless APIs - The good, the bad and the ugly
Serverless is a buzzword that we keep hearing quite often. The value proposition of serverless is clear: it takes away the complexities of creating and managing highly available and scalable applications while allowing you to focus on business value and significantly reduce operating costs.Different cloud providers offer serverless Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) platforms that allow you to build and deploy applications at a very high speed. However, serverless does not fit every single scenario. In this talk, we will see how easy is create and deploy serverless APIs, but also go deeper and discuss use cases, best practices, instance lifecycle, constraints and drawbacks covering the good, the bad, and the ugly of serverless.

Speaker: Paco De la Cruz, Cloud Architect & Developer, Deloitte Platform Engineering
Paco is a Senior Cloud Solutions Architect and Developer and Azure MVP with 18+ years of professional experience architecting and implementing integration solutions and distributed applications; more recently focused on Azure and cloud applications. As a consultant, Paco has had the opportunity to work for many different organisations solving very interesting and complex challenges.

SESSION 2
First look into .Net Core 3.0
.NET Core 3.0 was officially launched at .NET Conf on 23rd September. .NET Core 3.0 is a major milestone and in this talk I will take a first look into it. I will focus on the most important changes in .NET and ASP.NET Core 3.0 in this talk.

Speaker: Pratik Khasnabis, Cloud and Digital Solutions Architect, AGL Energy
Pratik is a Solution Architect with a developer background and experienced in all things related to integration (web service, api, message/service bus, events). He has been tinkering on Azure since it was first announced and he is passionate about Azure and a strong advocate of cloud native architecture patterns.
He has previously presented at - DDD Melbourne - Vic.Net meetups and most recently at Serverless-Conf and NDC Sydney conference.

AGENDA:
5.30 PM - 6.00 PM | Networking + Pizza & Drinks
6.00 PM - 6.30 PM | Session 1 + Q&A
6.30 PM - 7.00 PM | Session 2 + Q&A
7.00 PM - 7.30 PM | Wrap up

Share your thoughts and pictures using: #PEtechtalk
